Flora tiene la edad de 50 años,estudio la secundaria y es soltera, ella nos platica que por mas de 4 años se ha dedicado a la venta de antojitos mexicanos, ella inicio a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que quería trabajar para salir adelante y como sebe cocinar rico pensó en iniciar a vender antojitos e inicio a caminar bien su negocio hasta el día de hoy continua con su venta, ella realiza sus ventas desde su hogar los fines de semana(viernes, sábado, y domingo) por las noches, también en otras ocasiones vende comidas corridas y se gana un dinero extra. "a mi me gusta andar movida, no debes estar atenido a lo que tienes, hay que buscarle porque el dinero no llega solo".

Un crédito de vision Fun le ayudara a comprar tortillas, frijol, carne, chiles, aguacate, queso, crema, tomates, cebolla, aceite, frijol, papas, plátanos, maíz, gas y refrescos para la elaboración de su venta.

Ella quiere que su negocio continué creciendo y ganar mas clientes para que sus ganancias aumenten. 

Este grupo agradece el apoyo que se les brinda con estos prestamos.
texts.en:
San Judas is the name of this group, made up of eight very friendly, joyful, and determined people who have their own businesses and a common goal: to give their families a better quality of life. This group is located in Tierra Blanca, Veracruz, where the main economic activities are trade and ranching. The members of this group and their businesses are as follows: Luiz Yovany sells footwear, Nicolasa sells tacos, Flora sells food, Miriam sells cosmetics, Ligia sells handbags, Melvi Anahi sells cosmetics, Silvia sells natural products, and Abraham sells meat.

Flora, 50, studied through secondary school and is single. She tells us that she has worked selling Mexican corn-based dishes for more than four years. She started working in her own business because she wanted to work to move forward. Since she knows how to cook well, she decided to start selling food and her business took off. Today, she continues with her business. She sells from her home on weekends (Friday, Saturday, Sunday) in the evening. Sometimes she sells food on other occasions and earns some extra money. "I like to be on the move. You shouldn't cling to what you have. You must search for it because money doesn't come in on its own." A loan from Vision Fund will help her to buy tortillas, beans, meat, peppers, avocado, cheese, cream, tomatoes, onions, oil, potatoes, bananas, corn, gas, and soft drinks to make what she sells. She wants her business to keep growing and gain more customers so that her profits increase. 

This group is thankful for the help provided by these loans.

loans.use: to buy tortillas, meat, peppers, tomatoes, onion, oil, beans, potatoes, bananas, corn, gas, and soft drinks.

loans.name: El Fresno De La Soledad Group

texts.es:
Doña Francisca tiene 46 años edad, ella es una mujer trabajadora; le gusta la tierra en donde vive, es un lugar lleno de vegetación y con unas vistas hermosas. Le pusieron a su grupo el Fresno de la Soledad ya que donde se juntaban había un gran árbol de fresno y para ubicar rápido el grupo le pusieron así, dice que ahorita ella esta triste porque su suegro está muy enfermito y que el formaba parte del grupo que era un señor muy trabajador y ahorita lo tiene muy delicado de salud ya que ella lo cuida. 
Francisca se dedica al cultivo de aguacates, dinde vive tiene un gran terreno en el cual cultiva maíz, flores de cempasúchil, duraznos, rastrojo etc. Dice que el terreno lo tiene dividido en dos  partes en una parte tiene el huerto de aguacate y en el otro lado es donde siembra, ella está pidiendo un crédito por que quiere comprarle a sus árboles de aguacate abonos e insecticidas para reforzarlos ya que ahorita tienen el fruto pequeño y para que no se les caiga el fruto necesita ponerle los insumos, dice que tiene 180 árboles y entre su esposo y ella los cuidan ya  que es lo que de herencia le dejaran a sus hijos. 
Platica que Visión Fund le ha hecho varios créditos y que en todos ha pagado bien y que gracias a estos ella a podido hacer crecer su huerto, platica que con lo que le baya a dejar de ganancias sus aguacates ella piensa comprar una bomba con mas capacidad para regar sus árboles. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Rogelio, Juan y Luis Antonio ellos invertirán en la compra de artículos para surtir una tienda de abarrotes y para la compra de insumos para mejorar las condiciones de huertos de aguacate.
texts.en:
Francisca is 46 years old. She is a hardworking woman. She likes the land where she lives; it is a place full of vegetation and beautiful views. They named their group "El Fresno de la Soledad" ["The Ash of Solitude"] because where they were meeting, there was a big ash tree, and to locate the group quickly, they gave it that name. She says that she is sad right now because her father-in-law is very ill. He was a member of the group and a very hardworking gentleman; now his health is very delicate, so she is taking care of him. 

Francisca earns her living growing avocados. Where she lives, she has a big field where she grows corn, marigolds, peaches, a stubble crop, etc. She says that she has the field divided in half; in one half she has the avocado orchard, and in the other half, she grows the other crops. She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy fertilizers and insecticides to strengthen her avocado trees; she has small fruit right now, and to keep them from falling off, she needs to apply these materials. She says that she has 180 trees and she and her husband take care fo them because they hope to one day leave them to their children as an inheritance.

She says that Vision Fund has made several loans to her and that she has paid all of them back well, and that thanks to those loans, she has been able to make her farm grow. She says that with the profits that she will earn from her avocado crop, she is planning to buy a higher-capacity pump to water her trees. The other members fo the group are named Rogelio, Juan, and Luis Antonio. They will invest in the purchase of items to stock a grocery store and supplies to improve the conditions of avocado orchards.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing avocados, like fertilizers, lime, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a married man. He has been a farmer for three years, and his farm is located in a productive area. He faces a challenge of lack of funds to run the farm. 

Benson plans to use the loan to buy chicks and chicken feed. He plans to use the anticipated profits to buy more chicks and to improve the family's living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He is an honest man and sees himself being  a regional supplier of chicken.

loans.use: to buy feed and chicks

loans.name: Concepta

texts.en:
Concepta is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as an honest person.

For the past ten years Concepta has run a food stall from which she sells sugar, cooking oil and other foods. Her stall is in an urban area where there are many customers, mostly nearby residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expansion.

Concepta’s previous loan with SMEP DTM was paid off successfully. She is now applying for a 45,000 KES loan to buy sugar, cooking oil and other food for her stall. Her goal is to significantly expand the business within five years and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil and other food for her stall.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a petty trader who deals in the sale of smoked fish and yams in Wegbe, Hohoe. Nancy has never received any formal education because her parent didn’t see a reason to send a girl child to school. She is married and has one child with her husband, who is into sand mining. Nancy has been selling smoked fish since six years ago. She assists her husband with the feeding of the family. Her loan will be used to buy a large quantity of fish and yams for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish and yams for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married, and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like sugar, canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

Nancy has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Nancy aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Tim is 26 years old and single. He lives in Jiminez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in his business for over three years and earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

He has joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Ma. Nesie

texts.en:
Ma. Nesie is 43 years old and married with 4 children.

Ma. Nesie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell.

Ma. Nesie has been in this business for 17 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling up to the middle school level and couldn’t continue because her parents had no funds to send her to school. Hence, she decided to learn a trade. Domingo is a local seamstress in Wegbe, Hohoe Township, which she has done for the past 16 years. Her husband is an auto mechanic. 

Domingo uses her income to help her husband with providing other basic needs of the family and with the payment of their children's school fees. Domingo will use the loan to purchase more linen, zippers, and assorted buttons for her sewing business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Domingo plans to save and acquire an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase to buy more linen, zippers, and assorted buttons for her sewing business

loans.name: Morny

texts.en:
Morny is petty trader in Wegbe, Hohoe. Morny has received formal education but only to the middle school level. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is in farming. 

Morny has been into petty trading for 14 years now. She supports her husband to pay for their children's school fees and also feed the home. Her loan will be used to buy plastic rubber containers, plates, and also deal in the sales of fresh fish since the demand is high in her neighbourhood. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy plastic rubber containers and plates, as well as sell fresh fish in her neighbourhood

loans.name: Cely

texts.en: Cely is 45 years old and married with two children. She is thankful because she was blessed with a productive business. She operates car services such as car washing and car painting as well as a sari-sari store. She gets all the expenses needed in their everyday living. That causes her to strive and work harder. She wants to acquire a good income everyday. Now, Cely is requesting additional capitalization to boost up her business. An amount of PHP 40,000 will be a great help in the purchase of car paint, car soap, and grocery items to stock her sari-sari store. She hopes for the approval of her loan requests in order to maximize her business and save for the educational purposes of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase car paint, car soap, and grocery items

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married and has four  children. Joyce is a provisions/mineral drinks seller at Wegbe, Hohoe, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a businessman. Joyce uses her income to give financial support to her husband. She will use the loan to purchase cartons of tinned tomatoes, milo, sugar, canned milk, and mineral drinks. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to save and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of tinned tomatoes, milo, sugar, canned milk, and mineral drinks.

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en:
Nzingo is 63 years old and a mother of five children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling farm produce in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 4,000.

Nzingo was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000 to buy seeds, some fertilizer, and other farm inputs needed for her business. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for two of her grandchildren to expand her farming activities. Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for her business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es un señor de 50 años quien tiene 12 hijos con su pareja y actualmente viven en Sololá.
El se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 15 años y lo realiza en el lugar de su vivienda. Eligio esta actividad por que puede trabajar a cualquier hora ya que mediante lo que labora, obtiene  ingresos  aceptables  y de esta manera  aporta a la economía familiar.  
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,500.00 para capital de trabajo ya que necesita cultivar papa, y así  poder generar más ingresos.
Uno de sus sueños es sacar adelante a todos sus hijos en los estudios para  que tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Alberto, 50, has 12 children and currently lives in Sololá. He has worked in agriculture for 15 years and he does this work where he lives. He chose this activity because he can work at any time, since through his work, he has an acceptable income and supports his family. He is applying for a loan of 
Q 5,500 for working capital because he needs to grow potatoes. This way, he will be able to earn more income. One of his dreams is to advance all his children in their studies so that they have better work opportunities.

loans.use: to have working capital that he needs to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Manzana Flat Group

texts.es:
Doña Anastacia es una mujer alegra y emprendedora y vive en el municipio de  Tierra Blanca algunas otras personas conocen este lugar como la Novia del Sol ya que en verano los calores son muy fuertes, las principales fuentes de empleo son el comercio y la ganadería. 

Doña Anastacia es integrante de un Grupo llamado La manzana, el cual esta integrado por 5 personas y cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad orientada al comercio.

Doña Anastacia desde hace 9 años tiene un pequeño establecimiento en el cual vende material de construcción y refacciones, ella nos dice que decidió poner este negocio para crear una funte de empleo para su familia y porque es muy rentable ya que siempre la gente construye sus casas o le hace reparaciones. 

ella esta muy contenta con su negocio ya que con el paso de los años esta prosperando y le da empleo a ella y ha su esposo, ademas de que siempre trata con personas y tiene oportunidad de hacer amistades.

un crédito de Visión Fund le ayudara a invertir en la compra de tuberías de pvc y material de acero para su posterior venta.

Ella espera que a futuro su negocio este mas surtido para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Elavures venta de abarrotes,
Santos cocina económica,
Perfecta venta de frutas y legumbres
Cruz venta de papelería.
texts.en:
Anastacia is a joyful and enterprising woman who works in the town of Tierra Blanca. Other people know this place as "Novia del Sol" because in the summer it gets very hot. The main sources of employment are business and ranching. Anastacia is a member of La Manzana group, which is made up of five members, and each one of them has a business. 

For nine years, Anastacia has had a small establishment where she sells construction materials and replacement parts. She tells us that she decided to start this business to create a source of employment for her family and because it is very profitable, since people are always building their homes and making repairs. She is very happy with her business, since over time it has prospered and provides employment for her and her husband. Also, she always deals with people and has the chance to make friends. A loan from Vision Fund will help her to buy PVC piping and steel to sell. She hopes to have a better-stocked store in the future to provide better service for her customers.

The other group members are: Elavures, who sells groceries; Santos, who sells food at good prices; Perfecta, who sells fruits and legumes; and Cruz, who sells stationery.

loans.use: to buy PVC piping and steel.

loans.name: Julia Paula

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Julia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Adobo de Carne para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación,  Julia se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene una pequeña parcela donde cultiva tuna, Julia trabaja todos los días realizando labores de campo y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Julia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes y cubrirá los gastos de riego de su cultivo, de esta manera Julia obtendrá una buena cosecha, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Julia is a 48 year old woman, and she lives in the city of Nazca.  She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  She devotes all of her efforts towards getting ahead.

Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources and out of the need to work in order to help her parents when she was very young, Julia was not able to study for a professional career.

In her free time she likes to entertain herself by watching television.  Sometimes she cooks the delicious ‘Adobo de Carne’ [marinated pork in sauce] to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, and with great determination and dedication, Julia works in agriculture.  She has a small piece of land where she grows prickly pear cactus.  Julia works every day doing the field work, and she can do it for approximately eight hours.  She feels good doing her work, and she believes that it is going well for her because of her experience and the kind way that she treats others.

Julia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help given to her, she will be able to buy manure and fertilizers.  She will also be able to cover the irrigation expenses for her crop.  This way Julia will get a good harvest.  She will continue working and putting forth effort in order to manage to fulfill her big dream of being able to increase her crops.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers, and to cover the irrigation costs.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 29, lives in Vale District with his 47-year-old mother, Ketevan. He is an artisan, working on construction sites and house renovations for private clients. His monthly salary is small and is the only source of income for the family.

George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

George then requested a 1500 GEL start-up loan from Credo. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup loans with easy terms to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as high-risk borrowers due to low incomes.

George wants to develop his farm, so with his loan he will purchase piglets. Ketevan will look after and raise them. When they are grown, some of the pigs will be sold for their meat, and with some of the profits he will get more piglets. This way he will be able to expand his farming and have a profitable family business. This new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo will significantly improve the living conditions of George’s family.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Abduljalil Group

texts.en:
Abduljalil group consists of four ladies from Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Huda is a 28-year-old married woman. She is the leader of the group. She is a hardworking housewife who aims to improve her living standards even though her house is vulnerable to falling down at any time. It is known that such things require a lot of money. She has started renovating her house, but now she is in short of money. She needs to complete the renovation tasks, so she has asked for a youth loan of 50,000 YER to buy construction supplies to use for the house. She wishes to buy furniture to use for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for her house

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en: Faisal is 29 years old and has two children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He has completed a diploma. He is a driver who has owned a bus for four years. He works hard to provide for his family's daily expenses, however the amount that he earns is low. He would like to buy spare parts to repair his bus but he doesn't have money. So, he applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. With this loan his business will run well and he will be able to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his bus

loans.name: Akubia

texts.en:
Akubia is a local chemist located at Wegbe, Hohoe. Akubia has received education to middle school level.  She is widow and has three children. Akubia had been a local chemist along with her late husband for the past 32 years, which they did together to support the family.

Akubia is responsible for the general upkeep of herself and her three children; hence, she decided to take a loan to keep the business going after she lost her husband. Her loan will be used to buy assorted drugs for sale. She hopes to save and use her new profits from her business for her old age.

loans.use: to buy assorted drugs for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 40-year-old married woman. She has one son who is one year old. She describes herself as a respectful and accommodating woman. 

Esther operates a general store where she sells home products such as flour, cooking fat, margarine, and cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a densely populated area.

She describes her biggest business challenges as the high price of home products and insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy home products. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, rice, salt, and other foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, age 61, is a dairy farmer. He has been engaged in this business for 15 years. His customers are local residents and retailers. He and his wife have seven children between the ages of 10 and 29 years old. 

He has applied for a loan in order to buy animal feed and construct a cow shed. He plans to use the anticipated profits from his business to buy more cows. He is a goal-oriented man and sees himself as becoming more successful in five years time. 

This is Wilson's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal fees and construct a cowshed

loans.name: Africa One Group

texts.en:
Ibrahimu, who is in his early 30s, is a photographer. He has been engaged in his photography business for the past 10 years and offers a broad scope of services. With his strong skills and solid experience, Ibrahimu is doing well in his business. He works from 8 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a profit each month. He and his wife have one son who is still very young.
 
This will be Ibrahimu's first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use his loan funds to buy a projector to improve his photography business. He dreams eventually of owning a studio carriage for video production. 

Ibrahimu will share this loan with his loan group, named Africa One, which totals 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a projector to improve his photography business

loans.name: Kitombo

texts.en:
Kitombo is a 50-year-old vendor of assorted goods in Mikindani, Mombasa. He is married and a father of two children. He has done this business for a period of eight years and he is doing great. He earns a monthly income of 19,800 Kenyan shillings. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD and this marks his sixth loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase more stock of torches and wrist watches, and plans to employ one youth to help him in selling with ease.

He will use the anticipated profits to buy a motorcycle. He hopes to have a big profitable business that will enable him to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of torches and wrist watches, and to employ one youth to help him in selling with ease

loans.name: Williminah

texts.en: Williminah is a married woman and has 2 children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a store that sells used clothes to customers. Her business is located in an urban area where there are many customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expansion. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more used clothes for selling. Her business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business and meet public demand. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM; her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Ma.leonora Theresa

texts.en:
Margaret Leonora Theresa, age 42, runs a general store business to earn an income. She and her husband live happily in a rural community with their three children. 

Due to financial hardship, she aims to improve her general store in order to generate sufficient income to help her husband in financing the education of the children. She plans to increase her product offerings in order to satisfy her customers' demand. As she currently has inadequate capital for this investment, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000. She will use her loan funds buy more stocks of rice, grocery items, charcoal, and pre-paid phone cards to offer for sale. 

Margaret Leonora Theresa is confident that she will be able to improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy rice, grocery items, charcoal, and pre-paid phone cards to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en: Kelvin is a single man. He describes himself to be good person. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. His business is located in an urban area where customers are many. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the inflation of prices. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to to buy a motorbike. His business goal is to have 10 motorbikes within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were paid successfully

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Awanyo

texts.en: Awanyo is married and has one child. She has never received any formal schooling. Awanyo is a petty trader and also a food vendor at Wegbe, Hohoe, which she has done since 2009. Her husband is a farmer. Awanyo uses her income to help her husband provide with the basic needs of the home. Awanyo will use the loan to purchase bags of rice, maize, gari, and a gallon of oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Awanyo plans to save for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, maize, gari for sale, gallon of oil.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en: Agustina, 45, is a very hardworking person who is devoted to her family. She has a piggery business that serves as a source of income. She began this business in order to generate enough income to support her children. Presently, she is asking for a loan of 22,000 PHP to buy feed, medicine, and vitamins for her pigs. This amount will be a big help in maintaining her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman with four children. She is into palm oil production in Wegbe, Hohoe, which she has done since 2008 after she got married and realized her husband's finances alone couldn’t keep the home going. Her husband is a driver. Rose uses her income to assist in catering for the home. Rose will use the loan to purchase firewood and heads of palm fruit. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to save and acquire a bigger pot for larger production. To prepare palm oil locally, she washes the palm fruit and boils it until it becomes soft and tender. She scoops the cooked fruit into a big mortar and gently pounds it with a pestle to avoid damaging the nut. She then scoops the pounded fruit into a bowl. Water is then added to the pounded fruit. The mixture of water and the pounded fruit is squeezed and filtered to get the juice out and the chaff removed. The chaff is sometimes used by the local people to light charcoal fires. The juice is boiled again and as it boils, the fresh oil will float to the surface of the pot. The oil is fetched from the surface, put into another pot, and left to cool.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and heads of palm fruit.

loans.name: Hartone

texts.en: Hartone is a married man who has been a rabbit farmer for three years. His customers are local residents. Hartone faces the challenge of insufficient funds to run his farming business. He plans to use the requested loan to buy rabbit feeds. Hartone will use the anticipated profits to buy his own house. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He is a honest man, and he hopes to own a big rabbit farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy rabbit feeds

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia has since repaid her previous loans successfully and this marks her third borrowing. She will use the loan to renovate her food stall and parking yard for her clients. She hopes to continue serving her clients well, since the parking yard will also be rented at night for those who do not have car parking but have cars. She hopes to prosper in both her businesses.

loans.use: to renovate her food stall and parking yard for her clients

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza, a 39-year-old married mother of three children, lives in Jiminez, Misamis Occidental. For the last 12 years, she has managed their coconut farm. This gives her an income of PHP 3,000. Analiza been a member of GDMPC since 2008. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In the future, Analiza wishes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Elizabeth Aracely

texts.es:
Elizabeth, 50 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Managua casada, madre de 9 hijos de los cuales tiene a cargo solos dos hijos menores de 14 y 8 años de edad los demás son independientes. Ella es costurera, este oficio lo aprendió por medio de su mama, tenían 27 años cuando comenzó a coser ropa, sus primeras piezas fueron cubre colchón, sabanas, fundas para almohadas poco a poco fue mejorando y aprendiendo a elaborar más piezas. Actualmente elabora  faldas, short, camisetas, pantalones, uniformes escolares y deportivos, vestidos etc. Además de eso realiza adornos para eventos tales como el dia de la madre, día del padre, cumpleaños. 
Ella requiere el crédito para comprar tela, agujas, elástico, hilos, botones, encajes, esta  inversión le permitirá tener más materia prima para trabajar, producir más ella tiene como visión lograr poner un taller de costura donde pueda dar empleos a más personas trabajando con máquinas de coser modernas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old and lives in Managua.  She is married and the mother of nine children. Only two of the younger children, ages 14 and 8, are under her care and the rest are independent.  She is a seamstress, a trade she learned from her mother.  She was 27 years old when she started sewing clothing.  Her first pieces were mattress covers, sheets, and pillowcases.  Gradually, she improved and learned to make more pieces.  Now, she makes skirts, shorts, T-shirts, pants, school and sports uniforms, dresses, and other items.  In addition, she makes decorations for events such as Mother’s Day, Father’s Day, and birthdays.

She is requesting the loan to purchase fabric, needles, elastic, thread, buttons, and lace.  This investment will provide her with raw material in order to work and increase production.  Her vision is to establish a sewing workshop where she can give people more jobs working with modern sewing machines.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, needles, elastic, thread, buttons, and lace.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is 46 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over 5 years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires for his motorcycle

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 56 years old and supports a family of five. She is a mixed farmer and also does milk sales. She learned about KADET LTD from other women in the market who are already registered. Her business earns her a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

Salome has acquired a second loan of KES 30,000, which she plans to use to build a bigger shed for his cattle. She will use the increased proceeds to pay the school fees for her children.

Her dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to build a bigger shed for her cattle

loans.name: Doctresa

texts.en:
Doctresa works every day in her business of buying and selling crabs and fish. This enables her to support her household expenses and the cost of her children's schooling. She believes that she is doing well in her business because she offers good quality of crabs and fishes as well as good companionship to customers. 

Doctresa is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional fishes and crabs to sell in the market. These will enable her to improve her income as she continues working hard.

loans.use: to buy additional fishes and crabs.

loans.name: Ganbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbayar, 27 years old, lives with his wife and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

He has been rendering a taxi service to local people on contract with a private taxi company for nine consecutive years and accumulated a vast amount of experience in this field. His wife is a saleswoman at a trade center. Also, he leases a tire repair workshop to people on a monthly basis. Last year, he began building a house on his land because living in a ger during the winter time is very hard. But due to a lack of finances, he has only built the house's foundation and now lots of work remains undone. So he is requesting a loan of 6,600,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as planks, cement, and gypsum. Using these materials, he can complete the house-building work and provide his family members with comfortable and warm accommodations. When his family moves into the house, they will reduce their coal usage for heating and it will contribute to the efforts against air pollution by releasing less carbon dioxide. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who lost his parent in his earlier childhood and has lived on his own until now.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for his home

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married and has 3 children. She has received basic education through middle school level. She is a local seamstress located in Wegbe, Hohoe. Mercy has been in the sewing business for the past 16 years. Her husband is military personnel. Mercy uses her income to assist her husband with some financial needs of the home and with other family members. 

Mercy will use the loan to purchase assorted zippers, to repair her sewing machine, and to buy cloth to sell to her customers. With the profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to save and acquire a sewing center.

loans.use: to purchase assorted zippers, to repair her sewing machine, and to buy cloth to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is 51 years old. She is from Nyalenda in Kisumu City, which is located in the western part of Kenya. Benter supports four people in her family: she is a widow and has three children who are 21, 17 and 14 years old.

She has a poultry farm, which has been her main source of income for the last four years. She makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

She has applied for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase poultry food and chicks for rearing. She will invest the anticipated profit back into the business. She has a dream of growing her business into a large one and educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry food and chicks.

loans.name: Ita Paso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ita paso está en su ciclo número 2do del programa de comité de mujeres, este es un grupo bastante numeroso que se unió para poder trabajar juntas las unas con las otras. Ellas son muy trabajadoras y se esfuerzan siempre por dar a sus familias lo que necesitan.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Librada, quien con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo montar para su comedor, ella trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, es conocida por ofrecer excelentes comidas a sus clientes y eso le ayuda y le da muy buena publicidad para seguir con lo que hace. Ella cuenta que su meta es seguir trabajando y ayudar de esa forma a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su local de comidas, como ser carnes, verduras, condimentos, harina, huevo y demás insumos, ya que esto le ayudará a seguir dando una buena calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called Ita Paso is in its second cycle of the program of committee for women. It is a rather large group who joined together in order to be able to work with each other. They are very hardworking and always striving to give their families what they need.

One of the members is Librada, who with a lot of effort and sacrifice was able to launch her food establishment. She works every day from early morning hours. She is known for offering excellent meals to her customers and this helps her and gives her good publicity to continue with what she does. She says that her goal is to continue working helping her family in that manner.

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies for her eating establishment, such as meat, vegetables, spices, flour, eggs, and other supplies, as this will help her to continue giving good customer service.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, spices, flour, eggs and other supplies

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 42 years old and has four school-age children. Being a responsible father, he aims to improve the family's status of living to give them a bright future. Despite the hardship of living, he has the determination to continue sending his children to school so that they will become professional in the future. 
Jessie operates a motorcycle transport business to generate additional income, along with farming. He is asking for a loan of PHP8,000 to buy the gasoline and spare parts needed for maintenance of his motorcycle. Through this loan, he believes that he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the gasoline and spare parts needed for maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Budhi Star Group

texts.en:
The Budhi Star Group is a women's self-help group formed 2 years ago with 5 members. They are based in Cawang, about 1 hour from central Jakarta, Indonesia. Siti is 39 years old and she sells cooked breakfast food in the morning. She is married and has 1 child. The woman standing in the middle of the group holding the group sign is Siti.

Siti has been running her business for 5 years. She has this business so she can increase the income for her family. Siti is requesting a Kiva loan to buy ingredients such as rice, flour, and chicken in bulk. Her plan in the future is to expand her kiosk. The other members in the group have catering business, pastry business, cooked food, and kiosk.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, and chicken for her cooked breakfast food business.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 53 years old. He lives in the small village of Samtredia District with his wife, son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren. Merab requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his family's business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have four milking cows and two calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides that, they have a vineyard and 500 nut trees. They sell the harvested products and cheese at local markets. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Merab requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Merab will open a car wash. He will purchase all the needed equipment for it and will work hard to increase the income of the family. Merab hopes that the car wash will be profitable and he will do his best to satisfy his clients. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a car wash

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto es un hombre de 55 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Ernesto pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Mecánica Automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Chicharrón para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ernesto trabaja como empleado en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, Ernesto trabaja todos los días y realizada labores de limpieza y cuidado del ganado vacuno de la empresa que trabaja, el puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Ernesto se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del tramite documentario para la obtención del bachiller de su hija mayor, la cual ha culminado satisfactoriamente sus estudios profesionales, de esta manera Ernesto desea apoyar a su hija para que se encuentre mejor preparada para conseguir trabajo, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hijo menor convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Ernesto is a 55 year old man.  He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and their two children, whom he loves and who are his main reason for living.  He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who along with his wife, dedicates all his efforts to helping their family get ahead.  Thanks to his efforts, Ernesto was able to study a technical career in automechanics.  In his free time, he enjoys cooking delicious chicharrón to share with his family. 

By his own initiative, with a lot of hard work and dedication, Ernesto works as an employee of a municipal business in his city.  Ernesto works everyday, completing tasks such as cleaning and caring for the herd of cattle at the business where he works.  He works approximately 8 hours each day and believes it is going well due to his good work performance and the kind treatment he extends to others.

Ernesto is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered, he will be able to cover the expenses of the necessary documents for his eldest daughter to obtain her secondary education diploma, which has satisfactorily completed her professional studies.  In this way, Ernest hopes to support his daughter so that she will be better prepared to obtain employment.  So, he will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of seeing his youngest son become a professional.

loans.use: to cover the expenses of secondary school for his daughter.

loans.name: 3 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 3 de Febrero gracias a su esfuerzo ya está en el ciclo numero 2. Ellas están trabajando arduamente y por medio de ese trabajo quieren ayudar a su familia para darles todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juliana, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas usadas de todo tipo, es con esto que tiene los medios para poder ayudar a los miembros de su familia. Es una persona muy trabajadora, que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
La Sra. Juliana solicita de este crédito para la compra de bijouteries para anexar a su negocio, lo que le ayudará a poder crecer más y ganar mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
The "3 de Febrero" group is in their second loan cycle thanks to their efforts. They are working tirelessly in the hopes of helping their families and to provide them with necessities so that they aren't without anything important.

Juliana is one of the members. She works by selling a variety of used clothing, which is how she is able to help her family. She is a hard-working person who starts working very early every day. She is thankful for this opportunity because it will be a big help.

Juliana is requesting this loan to buy jewelry to grow her business, which will help her expand and gain more customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell and grow her business

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a married man, aged 24 years, with one child. He operates a retail shop where he sells commodities such as sugar, maize flour, and bread, and he plans to buy more stock with the loan. Elijah also sells cushions. 

Elijah plans to use his anticipated profits to help his shop grow further. Elijah sees his shop grown in five years time. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He is an honest man.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as sugar, bread, and maize flour.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Trabajadoras  y está en su ciclo número 6º  del programa donde cada una de ellas está poniendo todo de sí para poder ir mejorando sus vidas y las de sus familias. Cada una de ellas quiere un mejor futuro para sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nilda quien por medio de la venta de prendas de todo tipo está saliendo adelante y tiene los medios necesarios para poder seguir ayudando a su familia y cubrir las necesidades del día a día. Ella es muy trabajadora y sueña con poder seguir creciendo y ser el día de mañana una gran microempresaria.
La Sra. Nilda Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropas usadas y nuevas, además de zapatos usados, etc para poder venderlos,  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: The “Mujeres Trabajadores” [Hard-working Women] Group is in its sixth loan cycle with the program.  The members are putting in all of themselves in order to improve their lives and the lives of their families.  Each one of the members desires a better future for her family.  One of the members is Nilda.  By selling all types of clothing, she is getting ahead and has the means necessary to be able to continue helping her family and meeting their everyday needs.  She is very hard-working, and dreams of being able to continue growing and being a successful small business owner one day.  Nilda is requesting this loan to purchase new and used clothing as well as used shoes to sell.  This will help her to realize her business plan and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Villa Industrial 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Villa Industrial II está empezando a trabajar, está en su ciclo uno y tienen un gran espíritu de superación y quieren llegar al máximo nivel del programa de mujeres.
La Sra. Migdonia es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de todo tipo. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que gracias al esfuerzo que está haciendo hoy en día ya está mucho mejor. Ella quiere que su mini negocio vaya creciendo y es por eso que siempre se esfuerza al máximo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de estantes de madera para colocar sus productos, lo que le ayudará a tener una mejor presentación para sus clientes y atraer a más de esa forma.
texts.en:
The “Industrial House II” group has just begun working together. They are beginning their first loan cycle. They have a large desire to move forward and want to be the best program for women.
Mrs. Migdonia is a member of this group. She sells all types of fruits and vegetables. She started with very little, and little by little, thanks to her efforts, she is doing much better. She wants her small business to continue to grow and that is why she always works very hard.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy wood shelves to display her products. This will help her present her products well to her customers and thereby attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy wood shelves to be used to display the fruit that she sells.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is  a divorced woman with seven children, all of whom are dependent on her. She has received some schooling, but only to middle school level.

Cecilia smokes and sells fish in Wegbe, Hohoe and the surrounding villages, which she has done for about 17 years now. Cecilia uses her income to pay for all the financial needs of her children and for herself, since she is no longer with her husband. 

Cecilia will use the loan to purchase cartons of fish and firewood. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to save for the payment of her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of fish and firewood.

loans.name: Noaf

texts.en:
Noaf is a 30 year old, married man with one child who lives in Aden, Yemen. He is a sales distributor of sweets in different areas around his city. He works hard to provide his unique child a better life. 

Noaf has found it difficult to accumulate a large amount of money to buy various kinds of sweets because most of the profit he makes goes to his family expenses, like clothes and food. Therefore, he decided to apply for a youth loan of 500,000 YER to expand his business and so he can include different and new kinds of sweets. He thinks that expanding his business will attract more customers, and in turn, result in more profit, improving his income and helping him go over the poverty line.

loans.use: to expand his business and include different and new kinds of sweets to boost profits.

loans.name: Nasalino

texts.es:
El Señor Nasalino tiene 40 años de edad vive en acompañada  desde hace 15 años con el señora Julia de 33 años de edad; la pareja tiene tres hijos de 12, 5 y 3 años.  Sus hijos son el motor de la pareja y el porqué de la lucha de todos ellos.
El Sr. Nasalino se dedica a la compra y venta de mandioca desde hace 7 años, se inició con un capital inicial que consiguió de su trabajo anterior, empezó a incursionar en este negocio y actualmente tiene formada su clientela y le surte a los negocios de los barrios de esta ciudad, trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, además le da fuente de trabajo a 4 personas que le está ayudando diariamente a poder realizar sus ventas.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de repuestos y realizar el mantenimiento normal de su vehículo que tiene un desgaste diario realizando su reparto,  así evitar que tenga problema y poder cumplir con su clientela entregando su productos sin inconvenientes.
texts.en:
Nasalino, 40 years old, has lived for 15 years with his partner, Julie, who is 33 years old. The couple has three children ages 12, 5, and 3. Their children are the force that drives them to fight for improvement.

Nasalino works by buying and selling cassava, and has done so for 7 years. He started with the capital he earned from his previous job and began to dabble in this business. Currently, he has an established customer base and he supplies businesses in the neighborhoods of the city. He works every day, starting very early in the morning. He also employs four people, who help him to make daily sales.

He is requesting this loan to buy spare parts and perform routine maintenance on his vehicle, which he uses daily for deliveries. It has experienced some wear and tear so he wants to fix the problem so he can continue providing his customers with their products without delay.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to perform maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 56 years old. She engages in a livestock raising business as her occupation. She has been in this business for nine years. She was satisfied with its great contribution to improve her family's living conditions. 

Antonia wants to expand her business and is asking for a loan amount of PHP10,000 to buy extra chicks, vitamins and feed for her goats. She hopes to acquire more income in order to lift their poor standard living.

loans.use: to buy extra chicks, vitamins and feed for her goats.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married and has one child. He describes himself to be a good person. 
Francis operates a Mpesa service business where he does transactions for customers by either depositing or withdrawing money. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an urban area where customers are many. 

Francis describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to add float to his Mpesa business. His business goal is to have a second Mpesa business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully

loans.use: to add float to his Mpesa business

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza, es una humilde comerciante de Managua, tiene 1 hijo de 15 años de edad el cual está estudiando en la secundaria. Ella se dedica  vender tortilla y nacatamales desde hace tres años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a vender ropa solo por encargo después decidió vender comida fue ahí que eligió dedicarse de tiempo completo a elaborar tortillas y nacatamales pues ambos son alimentos de popular consumo. 
Esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar maíz, leña, hojas de plátanos, aceite, tomates, cebolla, carne. Todos ingredientes para elaborar nacatamales y sus tortillas. Tiene como meta lograr vender más nacatamales a comiderias y ahorrar para pagarle los estudios a su hijo.
texts.en:
Maritza is a modest merchant from Managua.  She has one child, 15, who attends secondary school.

She has made a living selling tortillas and nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] for three years.  Previously she sold clothing on order but then decided to sell food.  That was when she decided to devote herself full time to making tortillas and nacatamales because both are popular.

She's requesting the loan to buy ingredients to make nacatamales and tortillas: corn, firewood, banana leaves, oil, tomatoes, onion, and meat.

Her goal is to manage to sell more nacatamales to restaurants and save to be able to pay her son's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, banana leaves, oil, tomatoes, onion, and meat

loans.name: San Agustin Emboscada Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Agustin Emboscada está en su ciclo número 5to  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas y cada una de ellas pone todo de sí, para poder crecer  y mejorar sus vidas.
Jorgelina,  ella cuenta que se dedica a la venta de sombreros de caranday, que ella misma hace, es una persona con mucha habilidad y es gracias a esto que está saliendo adelante. Vende por varias zonas de la ciudad y con ello está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de caranday, que es su principal insumo para hacer sus sombreros. Agradece la oportunidad que ellas y sus familias están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “San Agustin Emboscada” group is beginning their fifth loan cycle. They are a group of women who together and separately give all their efforts to develop and improve their lives.
Jorgelina sells hats made of palm fronds. She is very talented and makes these herself. Thanks to this gift she is able to progress. She sells her goods in various areas of the city and because of this she can progress.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy more palm fronds. This is the most important item she needs to make her hats. She is thankful for the opportunities that the group and their families receive.

loans.use: to buy palm fronds to make hats.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 33 years old and married with three children.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Arlene has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Arlene aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Due to the hardship of living, Luzviminda engages in a vegetable vending business to generate additional income. She is 55 years old and has three adult-age children. She aims to strengthen her business and make it profitable in order to gain sufficient income. To improve the business, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more tomatoes, beans, okra, eggplant and cabbages to sell. Having patience and hard work, she believes that she will make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, beans, okra, eggplant and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP20,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

Lolita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Lolita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Nduni

texts.en: Nduni is a married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 16 years to 39 years. She describes herself as quiet. She operates a goat selling business where she sells goats to customers. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a suburban area where customers are many. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to expand the business. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to to buy more goats to sell. Her business goal is to have a butchery within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria, de 41 años de edad, es originaria de Managua departamento de Nicaragua, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pequeña pulpería , la cual inicio hace 7 años con capital que obtuvo de su liquidación cuando trabajaba en una empresa textil como obrera. Ella deseaba emprender su propio negocio así que decidió invertir todo lo que tenía para lograr poner su pulpería. Además para conseguir otros ingresos vende sandalias hechas de manera artesanal. 
Ella esta solicitando el crédito para comprar granos básicos, aceites, pasta de dientes, papel higiénico detergente, jabones, enlatados, galletas, pan, huevo, leche. Ella desea logra tener una distribuidora de alimentos y vender en el mercado  para captar a mas clientela y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, 41, is from the department of Managua in Nicaragua.  She's a merchant and owns a small store that she started seven years ago with capital she had from severance pay when she was a worker in a textile company.  She wanted to set up her own business so she decided to invest everything she had in setting up her store.  To earn additional income she sells handmade sandals.

She's requesting the loan to buy staples, oil, toothpaste, toilet paper, detergent, soap, canned goods, cookies, bread, eggs, and milk.

She wants to have a food distributorship and sell in the market to attract more customers and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy staples for her store

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado (San Isidro) está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, están aprendiendo a trabajar las unas con las otras. Ellas quieren superarse a sí mismas, y también ayudar a sus familias.
Todas las integrantes se dedican a la cria y venta de animales de corral, ellas cuentan que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que todos los días deben de estar pendientes de sus animales y ver que no les falte nada. Es un trabajo de tiempo completo. La Sra. Eulogia, la presidenta, cuenta que solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y de esa forma procurar que no les falte.
Ellas agradecen por esta oportunidad que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group named San Isidro is in its first loan cycle of the program with this committee of women.  They are learning how to work with each other.  They all want to improve themselves and also help their families.  All of the members work raising and selling livestock.  They comment that this is a job that requires a lot of sacrifices, since everyday they have to be mindful of their animals and make sure they don't lack anything.  It is a full time job.

Eulogia, the president of the group, comments that they are requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of balanced animal feed, and in this way procure what they need.

They are grateful for this opportunity which will be a great help.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed for the animals.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó en la ciudad  de  Curuguaty es llamado (Mujeres Unidas) está en su ciclo ´primer ciclo, y cuentan que todas se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias para poder crecer. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que decidieron tomar las riendas y luchar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Justina, quien tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida. Ella por medio de su negocio y de su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Comenta que hoy en día es muy difícil poder luchar contra la competencia, pero que ella aun así se esfuerza por crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, frutas, comestibles a granel, fideos y demás, ya que con ello podrá tener bien surtido su negocio y seguir ayudando a su familia y también cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group, founded in the city of Curuguaty, is called “The United Women”. They are beginning their first loan cycle. They are united in order to help their families grow. They are women leaders of their families that have decided to grab the reins and move forward.
One of the members of the group is Mrs. Justina. She has a small grocery store that has a good variety of items. Because of her business and her own efforts, she has been able to progress. Today it is more difficult to compete but she keeps up her efforts to grow the business and succeed.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy vegetables, fruit, bulk grocery items, noodles and other items. In this way she can have a good variety of items in her business. She can then help her family and also fulfill her customer’s requests.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, bulk grocery items, noodles and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Mujeres Trabajadoras II está en su Primer Ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, están entusiasmadas y con ganas de salir adelante. Ellas quieren y luchan por sus familias, y más por sus hijos, ya que quieren darles todo lo que necesitan para ser bien educados.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Carolina quien con su venta de productos de limpieza, está saliendo adelante, ella compra los productos de limpieza como microfranquicias que la fundación paraguaya les ofrece. Ella eta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe al formar parte del comité.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  microfranquicias de limpieza, ya que con ello podrá seguir con sus ventas y seguir teniendo los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Trabajadores” [Hard-working Women] Group II is in its first loan cycle with the program.  This committee of women is enthusiastic and has a strong desire to get ahead.  They love and strive for their families and even more for their children because they want to provide them with all that they need to be well-educated.  

One of the members is Carolina, who sells cleaning products.  She is getting ahead and purchases her cleaning products through a micro-franchise, a program offered by “Fundación Paraguaya”.   She is very grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving to join the committee. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cleaning products micro-franchise as this will enable her to continue her sales and continue earning income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cleaning products micro-franchise.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
En su séptimo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres se encuentra este grupo de la ciudad de Villarrica, ellas son muy sacrificadas, y tienen como meta el crecimiento de cada una, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teófila quien hace individuales, manteles, servilletas, camineros etc. Gracias a la venta de estos productos que hace ella esta saliendo adelante. Todo lo que fabrica le sale muy bien y es por eso que le va muy bien, tiene excelente clientela y quiere seguir creciendo. Su meta es poder tener algún dia un taller de costura.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de: (telas de ao po´i, liensos e hilos), lo que le ayudará a poder concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This is the seventh loan cycle for this committee of women from Villarica City. They have made many sacrifices and have the goal of growing both economically and individually. 
One of the members of the group is Mrs. Teofila. She makes napkins, tablecloths, table runners, etc. Thanks to the sale of these products she has been able to progress. Everything that she makes turns out well and that is why she is doing so well. She has a good customer base and she wants to continue to grow her business. She hopes to have a clothing manufacturing business one day.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy fine fabric, frames and thread. These will help her develop her business and thereby increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fine fabric, frames and thread order to make tablecloths, napkins, table runners, etc.

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es:
Jessica, es una joven de 23 años de edad, madre soltera tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad , ella se dedica a vender CD y celulares desde hace. Inicio vendiendo gaseosas, agua embotellada, refrescos luego su hermano le dio el local para que ella trabajara sola y fue agregando más productos nuevos como es la venta de los CD que actualmente tiene, le ha agregado la venta de celulares , accesorios para teléfonos . Ella tiene solo un ayudante que trabaja con ella , es de esta manera que se gana la vida a diario. 
Está solicitando el crédito para comprar DVD, 1 Parlante y accesorios para celulares y poder vender más para mejorar los ingresos. Uno de sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, ampliarlo más para una buena presentación.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 23-year-old young woman and a single mother. She has one 7-year-old child. She makes a living by selling CDs and cell phones. She began by selling soda water, bottled water, and soda. Later her brother gave her the premises so that she could work by herself and she added more new products, such as the CDs she now sells, cell phones, and phone accessories. She has only one assistant who works with her. This is how she makes a living each day.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy DVDs, a loudspeaker, and cell phone accessories so she can sell more in order to improve her earnings. One of her future plans is to improve the infrastructure of her business by widening it in order to present it well.

loans.use: to buy DVDs, a loudspeaker, and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Cesia Raquel

texts.es: Cesia de 36 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante, ella vive junto a sus padres y su hijo de 6 años de edad, ella se dedica  a la agriculatura desde ahce varios años su principal siembra es el maiz y el frijol, lo que realiza con la ayuda de su padre. ella solicita un credito que le permita comprar todo lo necesario para su siembra como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, entre otras cosas y tambien podre darle una mejora a su terreno donde siembra para poder tener mejores cosechas y obtener mejores ganacias para darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: 36-year-old Cesia is a very hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. She lives with her parents and her six-year-old child. She has made a living from agriculture for several years. Her main crops are corn and beans, and she plants these with the help of her father. She is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy everything she needs for planting, such as seeds, fertilizers, and compost, among other things, and which will also enable her to improve the land where she sows her crops so that she can have better harvests and obtain better profits in order to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and improve her land

loans.name: Rafaela Antonia

texts.es:
Rafaela, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el cultivo de maíz, ya que los préstamos generan muchos ingresos; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y pago de mano de obra.
El crédito anterior le permitió aumentar la producción y sus ingresos, estos los invirtió en la alimentación de sus hijos; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen, el grupo familiar es el mismo y están bien de salud.
texts.en: Rafaela is requesting a new loan because she needs to invest more in her corn crop. Since the loans generate lots of income, she will be able to buy compost, herbicides, and insecticides, and pay for labor. The previous loan allowed her to increase her output and her earnings; she used these to feed her children. Her economic conditions have improved, the family circumstances remain the same, the family is the same, and they are all well.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, and insecticides, and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, and pesticides, among other things

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 41 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Edna has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell at her food stall.

Edna has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Edna would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Mujeres Responsables Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Responsables está en su ciclo número 5º , con gran esfuerzo están saliendo adelante, quieren poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas.
Sara, la presidenta de este grupo, cuenta que ella siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras, para que luchen y den todo de ellas siempre. Ella por su parte se dedica a la costura, y es mediante este trabajo que logra ayudar a su familia. Gracias a que siempre hace un buen trabajo es que ya tiene muy buena clientela, y ella quiere seguir creciendo.
Ella está solicitando de este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres Responsables” [Responsible Women] is in its 5th loan cycle. With a lot of hard work, they are getting ahead. They want to be able to help their families through work and by cooperating together.

Sara is the president of this group. She tells us that she always tries to motivate her fellow members, so they’ll always work hard and give it all they have. She works as a seamstress and it is through this work that she is able to support her family. It is because she always does a good job that she has a good client base, and she wants to continue growing.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics, threads, elastics, buttons, and other things. In this way she can continue fulfilling the requests from her clients.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, elastics, buttons, and other things

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is 46 years old and she is happily married to Rodolfo who works as maintenance staff. They are blessed with four loving children and all of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard but they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Jocelyn owns a variety store. This is a small store that is connected to or just inside their house. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, cooking oil or an egg, for example. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price then she sells it per piece for a higher price for profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerbys and the people in the community. She earns 300 PHP a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Jocelyn desires that her business will continue to grow and she is hoping to have more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell in her business.

loans.name: Dhahaba

texts.en:
Dahaba is a married mother of five children, ranging from two years to 16 years old.  She describes herself as very social and helpful. 

Dahaba operates a cloth store and she has been in business for five years, in an urban area where customers are many. 

She says her biggest business challenge is the poor customer awareness of her business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to put up a structure where she can sell her clothes.  Her business goal is to have a large boutique within five years. 

Dahaba hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children and buy land. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to put up a structure where she can sell her clothes.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marina works hard to support her family.

She sells dried fish in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF in to buy more dried fish to sell.

Marina has sustained her business for the past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mutie

texts.en:
Mutie, 51, is a married with six children.  All attend school and are still under his care.  They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mutie operates a clothes business at the market and sells to town dwellers and neighbors.  His major challenge is the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan he is requesting he wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Luis Guillermo

texts.es:
