Ever changing customer preferences and prolonged rainy seasons affect her business while her dream is to own a fashion house. Rose intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is married and has seven children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a firewood selling business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. Mjeni faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of incorporating charcoal into her existing business in the near future.

With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is a married 31-year-old father of four children. He describes himself as an honest and faithful person. He is applying for a KES 20,000 loan through SMEP DTM to enhance his business buy buying a variety of products for his retail shop.

His other source of business include farming and quarrying. This is his first application for a loan. He sees himself with a variety of shops in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his shop.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 33 years old, and has three children with her live-in partner. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a business selling fruits and vegetables in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over four years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

She joined in GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family's basic needs.

Halima has operated a coconut selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her business.  She dreams of expanding her existing business to earn more profits. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 20 sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Salinah

texts.en:
Salinah is a 65-year-old married woman with 10 children. She is a farmer and is focused on her dairy which produces milk. 

She is applying for a KES 30,000 loan with SMEP DTM that will enable her to expand her business and supply milk to the neighbouring town, Nakuru. The profits will be used to pay for her childrens' education.

loans.use: To buy food for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is 29 years old, married with three children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like noodles, coffee, sugar, shampoo and soap.  In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like noodles, coffee, sugar, shampoo and soap

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married woman with 10 children. She is applying for a Kes 10,000 loan through SMEP DTM to enable her to plant farm produce  like maize, tomatoes and beans. She will be able to buy seeds for crops to plant through the loan and supply the neighboring market of Nakuru town thus getting more customers for expansion of the business. She plans to repay her loan through monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy seeds for crops to plant

loans.name: Flamingo Group

texts.en:
MOHAMED has been running an electronics shop selling electronics spare parts for a period of three years now. He is also an electrician.  He is a single man aged mid-20s with a son who is still young. He is doing fine in this field and his family is as well. He works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be his second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to restock more TVs spare parts. With the returns earned he covered household expenses together with reinvesting back into the business . He will use this loan to restock more electronics spare parts for his shop. He dreams of expanding his business.

He will share this loan with his loan group " FLAMINGO " which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more electronics spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is married and has been blessed with four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She cites paying for food and school fees as her major challenges.

Josphine has operated a vegetable and fruit-selling business in which she sells retail to her neighbors and town-dwellers. She faces a major business challenge of the bulkiness of her goods and, hence, the high cost of transportation. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, Josphine wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais uma irmã que vive com ela.
É comerciante vende produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (óleo, cerveja, arroz, refrescos, farinha, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e voltar a estudar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é investir mais no seu negócio e economizar para poder pagar o empréstimo solicitado.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother of 2 children who go to School; she lives in a house she owns and supports a sister who lives with her.

She's a trader and sells various products. With this loan she plans to buy products (oil, beer, rice, sodas, flour and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future Ana hopes to grow her business and go back to school. To this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

Her challenge is to invest even more in her business and save to be able to pay for the loan she has requested.

loans.use: buy products (oil, beer, rice, sodas, flour and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La clienta vive en Guayaquil.  Hace tres años escogió esta actividad porque quería tener una fuente de supervivencia, entonces comenzo a vender cosmeticos, perfumes, cremas, poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos. Tambien pudo consegir un trabajo en una emrpesa donde ella saca copias, en tal lugar trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, y en algunos momentos vende cosmeticos a sus compañeros del trabajo y tambien vende los fines de semana.

La clienta tiene una discapacidad que desde hace años atras tiene problema ya que le fue amputada una de sus extremidades inferiores, por eso ella ahora hace todo lo posible por mejorar sus ingresos. 

No tiene conyugue, ni hijos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mercadería para su negocio de venta de cosmeticos y perfumes, su sueño es poder tener un bazar y conseguir una casa propia.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil. Three years ago, she chose to pursue her line of work because she wanted to have a means of supporting herself. This is how she began selling cosmetics, perfumes, and crèmes, and gradually she was able to improve her income. She was also able to continue her job at a company where she is in charge of making copies. The borrower works at her job from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. She takes some time to sell cosmetics to her coworkers, but she also sells on the weekends.

The borrower has been a living with a disability for a number of years. She had a problem that resulted in the amputation of one of her lower extremities. Now she is doing everything possible to improve her income.

The borrower does not have a husband or children. With this loan, she wants to buy merchandise for her business of selling cosmetics and perfumes. Her dream is to have a bazaar and to acquire a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Honorato

texts.es:
Honorato nació en la comunidad de Mika y vive en esta misma comunidad. (La comunidad de Mika está localizada en el distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 40 años de edad, es casado por este lazo matrimonial tiene cuatro hijos. 

Honorato es un padre emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a la agricultura y brinda servicio de transporte, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz, oca y otras cosas más. 

Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  fertilizantes y semillas. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Honorato was born in the community of Mika and still lives there. The community of Mika is located in the District of Colquepata in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru.

Honorato is 40 years old, married, and has four children. He is an enterprising and hardworking father who works as a farmer and provides transportation services. He has several plots of land on which he grows potatoes, barley, corn, oca, and other crops.

A group of neighbors invited him to participate in the “Intipakareq” Communal Bank because he is a responsible and cheerful person. Honorato is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that he can buy fertilizers and seeds. He thanks everyone for this loan and promises to be punctual with his payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 32 years old and married with two children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a pedicab transportation service to earn a living. She has been in her business for over four years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. 

Lilian has been a member of GDMPC since 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 48 years old. She sells construction materials. She is married with eight children aged between six and sixteen. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more bricks and stones to use in building. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bricks and stones for sale.
